title: Development of an Educational Impact Evaluation Framework: Designing Computation, Formula, and Statistics-Based Assessment Systems to Strengthen Elementary Mathematics Teaching Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematics pedagogy knowledge, understanding of fundamental formulas, equations, and statistical concepts, and foundational literacy in data-driven educational assessment methodologies
context.additional_context: Enhancing elementary school teachers' capacity to develop assessment systems for measuring mathematics education effectiveness. Focuses on evaluating core mathematical competencies (computational skills, problem-solving strategies, graph utilization) in elementary students. Derives evidence-based improvement plans through statistical verification and probabilistic modeling, cultivating analysis and interpretation skills using real educational data.

learning_goals: Acquire the ability to design ≥3 scientific evaluation metrics (e.g., calculation accuracy, problem-solving time, graph interpretation skills) for measuring educational program effectiveness using mathematical modeling and statistical validation methods.

Learners draft an assessment framework for public educational institutions' learners (30s age group) based on elementary math concepts (equations, statistics, probability), and submit an evidence-based report integrating ≥3 analytical methods (e.g., linear equation modeling, basic statistical distribution interpretation, probability simulation).

Develop the ability to execute ≥2 data collection methods (e.g., digital eye-tracking, equation-solving process recording) for learning outcome analysis, apply probabilistic/statistical validation (e.g., t-tests, correlation analysis), and demonstrate educational effectiveness.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
